children.definition: Administrative agent consent is typically required for all assignments, exercised in the agent's reasonable discretion. Ensures orderly record-keeping and prevents problematic transferees.
children.name: Admin Agent Consent
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 13; KCT Cat 5 Item 3

children.definition: Borrower cannot unreasonably withhold consent to assignments. Standard formulation that balances borrower influence over lender composition with market liquidity needs.
children.name: Not Unreasonably Withheld Standard

children.definition: Borrower consent requirement falls away upon payment/bankruptcy Event of Default, ensuring distressed debt can trade freely when borrower is in default.
children.name: EoD Consent Fallaway
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 13; Review Template Row 132 (Assignments – consents)

children.definition: A mechanism for assignments, exercised on a 'not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed' basis. Falls away during Event of Default to ensure liquidity. []
children.name: Borrower Consent

children.definition: Requirement that the issuing bank approve any assignment of a lender's commitment that includes a participation in the letter of credit sub-facility. The issuing bank's consent right protects it from bearing reimbursement risk with an assignee it has not evaluated, since the issuing bank looks to the participating lenders for reimbursement of drawn LC amounts.
children.name: Issuing Bank Consent

children.definition: Minimum dollar amount for each individual assignment to prevent fragmentation of the lender group. Standard is $500,000 to $1,000,000 depending on facility size. Agent may waive.
children.name: Minimum Assignment Amount

children.definition: Processing fee (typically $3,500) payable to the administrative agent for each assignment to cover administrative costs of recording the transfer and updating the register.
children.name: Assignment Fee
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 32 (Ticking fee); DLS Preferred Row 35 (Administration fee); KCT Cat 3 Item 13

children.definition: If borrower or agent does not respond within specified business days (typically 10 BD), consent is deemed given. Prevents indefinite holdups in secondary market trading.
children.name: Deemed Consent for Assignments
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 6; KCT Cat 3 Item 13; Review Template Row 132 (Assignments – consents)

CONSENT_REQUIREMENTS.label: Consent Requirements
exactPhrases: during the continuance of an Event of Default
during the continuance of an Event of Default

children.definition: Framework governing the procedural requirements for transferring loan commitments in the secondary market. DLS Preferred row 94 provides the complete specification: Revolver assignments require consent of Administrative Agent and Borrower (not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed), except for assignments to existing revolving lenders/affiliates and during EoD. Term Loan assignments require Agent consent (waived for lender-to-lender/affiliate/approved fund) and Borrower consent (waived for lender-to-lender/affiliate/approved fund and during EoD). 10 business day deemed consent for Borrower. Minimum assignment $500,000. $3,500 agency fee per assignment. New lenders must complete tax forms. Assignment and assumption agreement required.

ASSIGNMENT_PROVISIONS.label: Assignment Provisions
exactPhrases: may assign to one or more Eligible Assignees

ASSIGN_CONSENT.label: Assignments - Consent Requirements
exactPhrases: [Identify unusual limits – can loans be pledged for leveraged facilities?]
if it is available to other lenders
if it applies after a payment/bankruptcy EoD
DQ List shall be made available
semanticVariants: borrower consent requirements for loan assignments

exactPhrases: may assign to one or more Eligible Assignees
[Identify unusual limits – can loans be pledged for leveraged facilities?]
if it is available to other lenders
if it applies after a payment/bankruptcy EoD
DQ List shall be made available
semanticVariants: borrower consent requirements for loan assignments

children.name: Assignment Mechanics

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred row 94 (complete assignment mechanics: consent requirements, deemed consent, minimums, agency fees, tax forms)

children.definition: Named competitors and industry competitors identified on the DQ list. 78% of DQ lists focus primarily on competitor exclusion to protect confidential business information.
children.name: Competitor Restrictions

children.definition: Expansive definition of 'affiliate' for disqualified lender identification purposes, capturing not only direct portfolio companies and investment vehicles of the sponsor's competitors but also their managed funds, advisory clients, and entities sharing common control. A broader definition reduces the pool of eligible assignees but provides stronger protection against competitors gaining access to confidential credit agreement information.
children.name: Known or Reasonably Identifiable

children.definition: Narrower standard where affiliates are DQ'd only if identifiable 'on the basis of name,' missing entities with different naming conventions but common ownership.
children.name: On Basis of Name Only

children.definition: How affiliates of DQ'd entities are identified: 'known or reasonably identifiable' (Geneva broader standard) vs. 'reasonably identifiable on basis of name' (narrower). Scope determines how effectively the DQ net catches related entities. []
children.name: Affiliate Identification Standard

children.definition: DQ list updates before closing require arranger consent. Some deals lock the DQ list at signing with no further additions permitted.
children.name: Pre-Closing Updates

children.definition: DQ list updates after closing, typically requiring agent consent. Controversial because commitment parties at signing may not know the full DQ universe.
children.name: Post-Closing Updates

children.definition: DQ list additions do not apply retroactively to existing holders. An entity that purchased before being DQ'd retains its position.
children.name: No Retroactive Application

children.definition: Whether and how the DQ list can be updated after closing. Pre-closing updates require arranger consent; post-closing typically require agent consent.
children.name: Post-Closing Update Mechanics

children.definition: Carveout for financial institutions with debt fund activities that might otherwise be caught by competitive exclusion prongs. Prevents over-breadth from excluding legitimate institutional investors.
children.name: Debt Fund Carveout
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 95 (Debt Fund Affiliates/Non-Debt Fund Affiliates); Review Template Row 5 (Disqualified Institutions)

children.definition: Whether the DQ list can be shared with prospective assignees on a confidential basis. Administrative agent typically has no duty to proactively monitor or enforce DQ list compliance.
children.name: List Sharing / Confidentiality

children.definition: Whether DQ restrictions persist during Event of Default. DQ lists that persist through EoD can block emergency liquidity by narrowing the universe of potential buyers of distressed debt. []
children.name: EoD Persistence

children.definition: Categories of excluded assignees that cannot acquire loan positions. DLS Preferred row 94 specifies: 'Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confidential basis. Administrative Agent shall have no duty to ascertain, monitor or enforce compliance with respect to assignments or participations to Disqualified Institutions.' PC Term Comparison: 'DQ List: Reject updating the list other than for competitors. Typically expect prohibition on assignments to DQs to fall-away on a payment or bankruptcy event of default.' Learning Material on DQ Lenders: includes known/reasonably identifiable affiliates and competitors identified from time to time, with bona fide debt fund exception for affiliate competitors.

CL_DISQUALIFIED_INST.label: Disqualified Institutions
exactPhrases: competitors not required to be identified in writing
competitors not required to be identified in writing

children.name: Disqualified Lenders List

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred row 94 (DQ institutions: prohibited assignments/participations, no agent monitoring duty); PC Term Comparison Assignments section lines 503-505 (update restrictions, EoD fall-away)

children.definition: Maximum percentage of facility debt that sponsor-affiliated entities may hold in aggregate. 25% standard, range from 0% (prohibited) to 30% (Geneva, above market).
children.name: Aggregate Holdings Cap

children.definition: Cap on affiliated lender votes in Required Lender determinations to prevent sponsor from controlling amendment outcomes. 49.9% standard ensures no majority control.
children.name: Voting Limitations

review_ref.term: Assignments – voting limit on Debt Fund Affiliates

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 95; Review Template Row 136 (Assignments – voting limit on Debt Fund Affiliates)

children.definition: Debt fund affiliates subject to identical restrictions as the sponsor entity itself, including aggregate holdings cap and purchase method restrictions.
children.name: Same as Sponsor Terms

children.definition: Debt fund affiliates receive separate, typically more permissive treatment: purchase term loans only, capped at 49.9% in Required Lender determinations.
children.name: Separate Framework

children.definition: Separate framework for sponsor debt fund affiliates that operate at arm's length. Two options: same terms as sponsor, or separate framework with uncapped holdings but 49.9% voting limit.
children.name: Debt Fund Affiliate Accommodation

review_ref.term: Assignments – voting limit on Debt Fund Affiliates

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 60; Review Template Row 136 (Assignments – voting limit on Debt Fund Affiliates)

ASSIGN_DEBT_FUND_CAP.label: Assignments - Debt Fund Voting Cap
exactPhrases: for purposes of determining Required Lenders
for purposes of determining Required Lenders

children.definition: Affiliated purchases must be offered to all lenders on a pro rata basis, ensuring equal opportunity to sell and preventing selective acquisition from accommodating lenders.
children.name: Pro Rata Offer
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 95; Review Template Row 133 (Assignments – open market purchases)

children.definition: Mechanism permitting the borrower's sponsor or affiliates to acquire loans through open market purchases on the secondary trading market, subject to limitations on voting rights, access to confidential information, and potential mandatory prepayment obligations. Open market purchases avoid the concentration and process controls of Dutch auction or direct solicitation methods.

golden_record_benchmarks.reason: Cross-deal parameter range available but no ontology benchmark

children.name: Open Market Purchase

children.definition: How affiliated entities may acquire facility debt: pro rata offer to all lenders, open market (non-pro-rata) purchases, or combination. Pro rata required in conservative deals.
children.name: Purchase Method Restrictions

children.definition: Affiliated lenders excluded from lender-only calls, meetings, and confidential lender-side information to maintain information barriers and prevent conflicts of interest.
children.name: Information Exclusion

children.definition: On sponsor/affiliate debt purchases. DLS Preferred position is 'Not permitted.'.
children.name: Complete Prohibition

children.definition: Restrictions on sponsor/affiliate entities acquiring facility debt. DLS Preferred row 95 (Debt Fund Affiliates/Non-Debt Fund Affiliates) provides two options: (Option 1) treat debt fund affiliates same as sponsor/non-debt fund affiliates; (Option 2) allow debt fund affiliate purchases with 49.9% voting cap. For sponsor/non-debt fund affiliates: purchases through pro rata offers or open market, capped at 20-25% of term facility, no attendance at lender-only calls, no lender-only information, no voting except for sacred rights, Agent votes on their behalf in bankruptcy, cannot exceed 49% of aggregate lender count. Loans can be contributed to Holdings for cancellation, treated as equity contribution building the builder basket. PC Term Comparison: 'Cap at 25/30%. No revolver draw. No vote/cap vote at 49.9% for debt fund affiliates. Try to cap number of Affiliated Lenders to avoid block on class vote.'

ASSIGN_AFFILIATED_LENDER.label: Assignments - Affiliated Lenders
exactPhrases: No cap on number of affiliated lenders
No express voting limits in bankruptcy
Not limited to term loans (i.e. can buy back revolver)
for purposes of determining Required Lenders
semanticVariants: sponsor control of lender group prevention

exactPhrases: No cap on number of affiliated lenders
No express voting limits in bankruptcy
Not limited to term loans (i.e. can buy back revolver)
for purposes of determining Required Lenders
semanticVariants: sponsor control of lender group prevention

children.market_benchmarks: DLS Preferred: 20-25% of term facility, no vote, 49% of lender count. PC Term Comparison: cap at 25-30%, no revolver draw, 49.9% vote cap for DFAs.
children.name: Affiliated Lender Restrictions

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: TL only (not revolver); pro rata offer or open market; capped at 20-25% of TL; no lender-only access; no voting rights (except sacred rights affecting them); Agent votes in bankruptcy; contribution for cancellation permitted (builds RP basket); 49% cap on number of affiliate lenders. Debt Fund Affiliates: same rules or 49.9% voting cap.
hot_button_items: term_name: entire field highlighted
key_negotiation_axes: voting_rights: none vs sacred_rights_only vs full

review_ref.term: Assignments – voting limit on Debt Fund Affiliates

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred row 95 (complete affiliated lender framework: two options, sponsor restrictions, DFA voting caps, cancellation mechanics); PC Term Comparison Assignments section lines 509-512 (cap, no revolver, 49.9% cap, avoid class vote block)

children.definition: Borrower buybacks completely prohibited. Eliminates voting manipulation and circular leverage risks entirely.
children.name: Not Permitted

children.definition: Structured competitive price discovery mechanism where all lenders may participate. More orderly than open market purchases.
children.name: Dutch Auction

children.definition: Buyback must be offered to all lenders on a pro rata basis, ensuring equal exit opportunity.
children.name: Pro Rata Offer
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 95; Review Template Row 133 (Assignments – open market purchases); Review Template Row 135 (Assignments – Borrower buybacks)

children.definition: Non-pro-rata purchases at borrower discretion in the secondary market. Maximum borrower flexibility.
children.name: Open Market Purchase
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 40 (Market MAC); DLS Preferred Row 54 (Clear market); DLS Preferred Row 61 (Clear Market); Review Template Row 133 (Assignments – open market purchases)

ASSIGN_OPEN_MARKET.label: Assignments - Open Market Purchases
exactPhrases: purchase Loans in the open market
semanticVariants: borrower loan purchases in secondary market
Dutch auction mechanics for loan buybacks

exactPhrases: purchase Loans in the open market
semanticVariants: borrower loan purchases in secondary market
Dutch auction mechanics for loan buybacks

children.definition: Whether purchased loans must be permanently cancelled upon acquisition. If not cancelled, borrower holds voting power on debt it has bought, creating manipulation risk.
children.name: Cancellation Requirement

children.definition: Whether buybacks are prohibited during an Event of Default. Prevents borrower from acquiring debt at distressed prices when it is in breach of the agreement.
children.name: Default Stopper

children.definition: Whether revolver draws can be used to fund term loan buybacks. Permitting revolver-funded buybacks creates circular leverage where the borrower uses one facility to retire another.
children.name: Revolver Funding Restriction

children.definition: Whether and how the borrower or Holdings can repurchase outstanding debt at a discount. DLS Preferred row 96 specifies: 'Term Loans may be purchased by and assigned to Holdings or any of its subsidiaries through [(a) open market purchases on a non-pro rata basis and/or] (b) Dutch auctions open to all applicable lenders on a pro rata basis; provided that (1) no event of default has occurred and is continuing, (2) any such loans are permanently cancelled immediately upon acquisition thereof, and (3) the proceeds of the Revolving Facility are not used to make any such purchases.' PC Term Comparison: 'Make Clients aware if non pro rata open market purchases/privately negotiated purchases are permitted or if any other provisions relating to buybacks/assignments to sponsor affiliates are not the tighter versions. Require Borrower/subs to cancel debt acquired. D/EofD stopper. Cap at 25/30%. No revolver draw.'

ASSIGN_BORROWER_BUYBACK.label: Assignments - Borrower Buybacks
exactPhrases: No prohibition on use of revolver
Assignments to unrestricted subsidiaries not required to be cancelled
No prohibition on use of revolver
Assignments to unrestricted subsidiaries not required to be cancelled

children.name: Borrower Buybacks

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: TL only; Dutch auction (pro rata) and/or open market (non-pro-rata); no EoD; immediate cancellation; no revolver proceeds
hot_button_items: term_name: entire field highlighted

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred row 96 (buyback mechanics: Dutch auction/open market, EoD stopper, immediate cancellation, no revolver draw); PC Term Comparison Assignments section lines 506-510 (tighter version requirements)

children.definition: Whether borrower and/or agent consent is required for participations. Typically less restrictive than full assignments since the lender of record does not change. []
children.name: Consent Requirements

children.definition: Whether participants receive voting rights on sacred rights (maturity extension, rate reduction, etc.) or only on their underlying economic interest. Voting pass-through limited to sacred items is market standard.
children.name: Voting Rights Pass-Through
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 3; KCT Cat 3 Item 13

children.definition: Whether the DQ list restrictions apply to participations in addition to assignments. If not applied, DQ'd entities can acquire economic exposure through participation even if they cannot become lenders of record.
children.name: DQ List Applicability

children.definition: Rights and restrictions for sub-participations where a lender sells an economic interest in its loans without transferring the legal position. Participant has economic exposure but the selling lender remains the lender of record. []
children.name: Participation Mechanics

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

children.definition: Limitation on the maximum percentage of outstanding loans that the sponsor and its affiliates may hold at any time, preventing the sponsor from accumulating a blocking or controlling position in the lender syndicate. Typical caps range from 10-25% of aggregate commitments, ensuring the sponsor cannot single-handedly control amendment or waiver votes.
children.name: Percentage Caps

children.definition: 50% voting limit for sponsor-held debt prevents dual control where sponsor controls both equity and a majority of the debt vote simultaneously.
children.name: Voting Restrictions

VOTING_INCORA_PROTECTION.label: Voting - Incora/Wesco Protection
exactPhrases: newly issued debt shall be excluded
newly incurred Loans shall not be counted
semanticVariants: Wesco protection against incremental debt voting
sacred rights protection against vote manipulation

exactPhrases: newly issued debt shall be excluded
newly incurred Loans shall not be counted
semanticVariants: Wesco protection against incremental debt voting
sacred rights protection against vote manipulation

children.definition: Restrictions on the private equity sponsor acquiring senior facility debt. Distinct from affiliated lender restrictions which cover broader affiliate group.
children.name: Sponsor Debt Limitation

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

review_ref.term: Negative Covenants – Transactions with Affiliates – Sponsor Management Fees

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 55 (Absence of other debt); DLS Preferred Row 95 (Debt Fund Affiliates/Non-Debt Fund Affiliates); Review Template Row 9 (Countersign date); Review Template Row 126 (Negative Covenants – Transactions with Affiliates – Sponsor Management Fees); Review Template Row 134 (Assignments – Affiliated lenders and buybacks)

children.definition: Standard Required Lender vote suffices to amend assignment provisions. Less protective.
children.name: No Restrictions

children.definition: Targeted heightened consent for particular assignment provisions. May require affected-lender or all-lender consent for key subsections.
children.name: Limited / Specific Restrictions

children.definition: Special purpose vehicle funding structure protection requiring specific consent for changes affecting SPC lender assignment rights.
children.name: SPC-Only Restriction

children.definition: Whether changes to the assignment provisions themselves require heightened consent beyond Required Lender threshold.
children.name: Assignment Amendment Restrictions

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 13; Review Template Row 49 (Documentation Precedent); Review Template Row 131 (Voting); Review Template Row 134 (Assignments – Affiliated lenders and buybacks); Review Template Row 135 (Assignments – Borrower buybacks)

children.definition: Negative covenant restricting the borrower from amending its organizational documents (certificate of incorporation, bylaws, operating agreement) in a manner materially adverse to lender interests. Protects against governance changes that could alter the borrower's authority to perform its credit agreement obligations, modify equity class rights, or change its jurisdiction of organization.
children.name: Organizational Documents
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 2; PC Term Comparison: 10. Other Items - Security Documents

children.definition: Restriction on amending subordinated debt indentures or agreements in ways that increase borrower obligations, shorten maturities, or add covenants.
children.name: Subordinated Debt Documents
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 2; PC Term Comparison: 10. Other Items - Security Documents

children.definition: Negative covenant restricting amendments to the management agreement or monitoring agreement between the borrower and its sponsor that would be materially adverse to lender interests. Prevents changes that could increase management fee amounts, accelerate fee payment schedules, or broaden the scope of indemnification obligations to the sponsor group.
children.name: Management Agreement
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 53 (Amendments to Acquisition Agreement)

children.definition: Restrictions on amending organizational documents, subordinated debt documents, and management agreements without lender consent. 61.3% overall prevalence.
children.name: Modification Covenants

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 78 (Affirmative covenants); DLS Preferred Row 88 (Other Negative Covenants); Review Template Row 124 (Negative Covenants – Transactions with Affiliates –)

children.definition: Whether assignments to known net-short entities are restricted or whether the DQ list extends to entities with adverse economic positioning through credit derivatives.
children.name: Transfer to Net Short Entities
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 3; KCT Cat 3 Item 4; KCT Cat 3 Item 13

children.definition: Whether affiliates acting in concert with net-short lenders are also subject to disenfranchisement, preventing circumvention through related party coordination.
children.name: Coordinating Affiliates
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 87 (Transactions with Affiliates); KCT Cat 3 Item 4

children.definition: Restrictions on net-short lenders from an assignment perspective: whether loans can be assigned to entities with known net-short positions and how such lenders are treated in the lender group. []

golden_record_benchmarks.reason: Parameter distribution data available but no ontology benchmark

children.name: Net Short Lender Disenfranchisement

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 60 (Lender Selection); DLS Preferred Row 96 (Buyback Provisions); KCT Cat 3 Item 3; KCT Cat 3 Item 4; Review Template Row 131 (Voting)

children.definition: Who has the right to appoint additional agents: Administrative Agent unilaterally (market), Administrative Agent with borrower consent, or Administrative Agent with Required Lender consent.
children.name: Appointment Authority

children.definition: Types of additional agents that can be appointed: collateral agent, co-administrative agent, documentation agent, syndication agent, local counsel agent (for multi-jurisdiction deals), sub-agent.
children.name: Agent Types

children.definition: Scope of decision-making power granted to supplemental agents that is independent of the primary administrative agent's authority. In most credit agreements, additional agents have no independent authority, but in certain multi-jurisdictional facilities, local agents may be granted limited powers to act in their jurisdiction for perfection, enforcement, or regulatory compliance purposes.
children.name: Independent Authority

children.definition: Provision permitting the appointment of supplemental agents (co-agents, syndication agents, documentation agents, or local agents) beyond the primary administrative agent and collateral agent. These additional agent roles typically carry no independent decision-making authority and serve primarily as titles recognizing the lender's role in the syndication or its local market presence.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=easy vs playbook=hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

children.name: Right to Appoint Additional Agents

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Borrower consent waived only for payment/bankruptcy EoD (not all EoD); no deemed consent; LC Issuer consent for LC sub-facility
hot_button_items: No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.
No assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons.

Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confident
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: Agent consent for all; Borrower consent (NTU withheld/delayed) except to existing lenders/affiliates or during EoD; 10BD deemed consent; $500K minimum; no DQ institutions/natural persons; $3,500 assignment fee

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 62 (Right to Appoint Additional Agents); DLS Preferred Row 94 (Assignments); KCT Cat 3 Item 13

children.name: Disqualified Institutions
children.definition: List of entities prohibited from acquiring loans or commitments through assignment or participation. DLS Preferred row 94 provides the framework: 'Disqualified Institutions: Assignments and participations to Disqualified Institutions are prohibited. List may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees and participants on a confidential basis. Administrative Agent shall have no duty to ascertain, monitor or enforce compliance.' KCT Category 3 item 13 flags: '(i) Consent rights to assignments or to voting participations do not fall away upon payment or bankruptcy Events of Default, (ii) non-voting participations require consent/notice, (iii) no "not to be unreasonably withheld" language, or (iv) DQ list requires the Administrative Agent or lenders to identify institutions without listing entity names.'

children.name: Initial List / Closing Date Identification
children.definition: The list of disqualified institutions identified at closing, typically attached as a schedule or delivered to the administrative agent. May include named entities, categories (e.g., competitors), or references to publicly available lists.
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 13 (Unknown); KCT Cat 1 Item 1

children.name: Post-Closing Update Rights
children.definition: Whether and how the borrower may update the Disqualified Institutions list after closing. Borrower-friendly terms allow unlimited additions; lender-friendly terms freeze the list at closing or cap additions. Updates typically cannot retroactively affect existing lenders.

children.name: Affiliate Capture
children.definition: Whether affiliates and related funds of disqualified institutions are automatically captured by the prohibition, and definition of what constitutes an 'affiliate' for this purpose. Broad capture prevents circumvention through fund vehicles.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: DQ list provisions typically in assignment section with cross-references to defined terms in Art I

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred row 94 (DQ framework: prohibition, posting, no agent duty); KCT Category 3 item 13 (four assignment/DQ formulation risk flags)

definition: Provisions governing how lenders may transfer their loan positions through assignments (full transfer of lender status) or participations (economic transfer only, without direct borrower-lender relationship). DLS Preferred specifies differentiated requirements by facility: Revolver assignments require consent of Administrative Agent plus Borrower (not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed), except for assignments to existing revolving lenders/affiliates or during an EoD, with 10 BD deemed consent for Borrower and $500K minimum assignment. Term Loan assignments require Administrative Agent consent only for non-lender/non-affiliate/non-approved-fund assignees, plus Borrower consent (same exceptions), with 10 BD deemed consent and $500K minimum. Universal prohibitions: no assignments to Disqualified Institutions or natural persons; $3,500 agency fee per assignment (waivable by Agent); new lenders must complete tax forms and Assignment and Assumption Agreement. DQ list may be posted to lenders and shared with potential assignees/participants on a confidential basis; Administrative Agent has no duty to monitor DQ compliance. KCT Category 3 item 13 flags: (i) consent rights not falling away upon payment/bankruptcy EoD; (ii) non-voting participations requiring consent/notice to borrower or sponsor; (iii) absence of 'not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed' language; (iv) DQ list requiring institution identification without listing entity names.
name: Assignments & Transfers
definition_source: DLS Preferred row 94 (complete assignment specification for revolver and term loans, DQ institution provisions); KCT Category 3 item 13 (assignment/participation risk flags); PC Term Comparison section 9 (reject snooze you lose)

market_benchmarks.dls_borrower_consent_fallaway: During EoD or assignment to existing lender/affiliate/approved fund
market_benchmarks.dls_dq_institutions: Assignments and participations prohibited; Agent no duty to monitor
